title: What Jimmy Kimmel’s Suspension Says About the Trump Administration’s Crackdown Against Mainstream Media
summary: ABC’s decision to “indefinitely” suspend Jimmy Kimmel’s late-night talk show illuminates the administration’s efficacy so far.

title: Who Is Brendan Carr, the F.C.C. Chair Who Played a Role In Jimmy Kimmel’s Suspension?
summary: The chairman of the F.C.C., who is in the spotlight for his comments that may have led to the suspension of late night TV show host Jimmy Kimmel, has long criticized the media for perceived bias.

title: Reactions to ABC’s Pulling of ‘Kimmel’ Reflect America’s Partisan Divide
summary: Fans and liberals expressed anger while conservatives hailed ABC’s decision to pull Jimmy Kimmel’s late-night show off the air after comments about the killing of Charlie Kirk.

title: Trump Asks Supreme Court to Allow Removal of Fed Governor
summary: President Trump had pressed to fire Lisa Cook before the central bank’s meeting, at which the Fed voted to cut interest rates.

title: The Fed Has No Good Options as Hiring Wobbles and Inflation Picks Up
summary: The central bank is grappling with how quickly to lower interest rates after restarting cuts on Wednesday, amid mixed economic signals and a relentless White House pressure campaign.

title: Melania Trump Wears Leather and Suede on Tour With Queen Camilla
summary: On day two of the state visit to Britain, the first lady opted for leather and suede.

title: Tiffany Trump’s Family Cruised the Mediterranean on an Oil Mogul's Yacht
summary: The vacation, amid diplomatic talks on oil industry expansion, is a measure of how hard it is to tell where the interests of government end and those of the Trump family begin.

title: How Tiffany Trump’s Instagram Posts Led Us to an Oil Magnate’s Megayacht
summary: Photographs left a trail of clues showing Ms. Trump and her husband, Michael Boulos, vacationing on luxury vessels owned by billionaires.

title: How Tiffany Trump’s Husband Benefited From Proximity to Power
summary: A Times investigation found that Michael Boulos and his family benefited financially from proximity to his in-laws for years.

title: I’ve Written About Loads of Scams. This Phone Scam Almost Got Me.
summary: The caller ID said “Chase Bank,” and the man on the line said I might be a victim of fraud. His supervisor would explain.

title: In Texas, Parents Fighting Vaccinations Say Their Movement Is Winning
summary: Public health advocates hoped that the measles outbreak might persuade the reluctant to get shots. That has not turned out to be true.

title: RFK Jr.’s Vaccine Committee to Vote on Hepatitis B and Covid Shots
summary: The panel will likely recommend against the combination measles-mumps-rubella-varicella vaccine. The advice for the separately given shots for those diseases remains unchanged.

title: Kennedy Announces Firing of Organ Transplant Group After Safety Problems
summary: Robert F. Kennedy Jr. announced the firing of one of the groups that arrange U.S. organ donations, effectively closing it down — and sending a warning to others.

title: E.P.A. Keeps Polluters on the Hook to Clean Up ‘Forever Chemicals’
summary: The decision came despite an effort by a former industry lawyer who is now at the E.P.A. to reverse the regulation.

title: Mahmoud Khalil Asks Federal Judge to Intercede After Deportation Order
summary: Mr. Khalil is not in imminent danger of deportation, but his situation has grown more dire as the Trump administration continues its efforts to remove him from the country.

title: Apple’s New AirPods Offer Impressive Language Translation
summary: The technology is one of the strongest examples yet of how artificial intelligence can be used in a seamless, practical way to improve people’s lives.

title: Why Obesity Is Killing American Men
summary: Men seek weight loss treatment far less often than women. Doctors are concerned.

title: What Will China’s Green-Tech Ambitions Cost the World?
summary: Laos is just one of the emerging markets where China’s green-tech revolution is installing more than cheap energy.

title: How China Became a Wedge Between Two South Pacific Neighbors
summary: A standoff between New Zealand and the Cook Islands reflects an urgent question in the Pacific: Is China a threat or a partner for growth?

title: With the Em Dash, A.I. Embraces a Fading Tradition
summary: The debate about ChatGPT’s use of the em dash signifies a shift in not only how we write, but what writing is for.

title: ‘Tax the Rich,’ French Protesters Cry, as the Wealthy Push Back on Paying More
summary: With a budget crisis looming, a proposal for a tax on ultrahigh-wealth individuals has grass-roots support, but it adds conflict to an already fragmented political landscape.

title: The Road
summary: A single image captures the desperation of Palestinians in Gaza City who have once again grabbed what belongings they could and fled the fighting.

title: Syria’s President Says Border Deal With Israel Could Come ‘Within Days’
summary: Syrian and Israeli officials have been holding talks about security arrangements along their shared border as part of U.S.-mediated efforts to reset decades of hostility.

title: Rifts Grow Between Netanyahu and His Security Chiefs
summary: As Israel expands its war in Gaza, decision-making has become increasingly concentrated in the hands of one person: Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu.

title: Texas Man Is Charged With Making Threats Against Mamdani
summary: The arrest of a man accused of targeting Zohran Mamdani, the Democratic mayoral nominee in New York City, came during an extraordinarily tense time for public officials in the United States.

title: Hong Kong’s Dim Sum Cart ‘Aunties’ Make Their Final Rounds
summary: Metropol, a massive banquet hall, is closing, and fading along with it is a cherished tradition of dim sum carts and the chatty women who push them.

summary: Larry Ellison is now suddenly poised to become the most powerful media mogul America has ever seen.

title: The Trump Administration Is Dismantling Climate Policies
summary: Once, the Trump administration merely downplayed the threat of global warming. Now it flatly denies the science.

summary: Drone attacks have become ubiquitous in warfare. We’ll find experts to answer your questions.

title: Wildfire Smoke Will Kill Thousands More by 2050, Study Finds

title: Newark Airport Crisis Has Eased but Tech and Staffing Issues Persist
summary: United Airlines said it had a very good summer at Newark airport. But air traffic control equipment issues and staffing shortages remained unresolved.

summary: The deal between the chipmakers, whose fortunes have diverged sharply, includes plans to collaborate on technology to power artificial intelligence.
